evidence.text:
Person A: Some of us are different. And there was a time, before you were born, when life in Oz was different. When one could walk these halls, and hear-- a Snow Leopard, solving an equation, or an Antelope, explicating a sonnet. So... when, and why-- did this change?
Person A: Precisely. Food gre w scarce. When people are hungry, and-- angry, they begin to look for--
Person B: Someone to blame.
Person A: Yes, Miss Gllll--

Person A: It's alright, I have no friends.
Person B: Well. Maybe... one.

Person B: Doctor Dillamond, what you were describing just now-- could something like that really happen?
Person A: It is happening.
Person A: Listen to me. You cannot tell another soul what you've heard and seen here tonight!
Person B: But-- that's why we have a Wizard!
Person A: My dear students, this is my last day here at Shiz. You see, Animals-- are no longer permitted to teach.

Person A: Not now, Miss Elphaba-- Please, everyone, take your seats, I've something to say, and very little time.
Person B: What?
